definition: so deep one cannot see to the bottom/limitless
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
background/bottom/base/end (of the month, year etc)/remnants/(math.) radix/base

sentences.english: The spring water is of dark green, deep and running all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 泉水碧綠凝重，深不見底，終年湧流不息。

sentences.english: If you can't see the bottom, jump in, don't dive.
sentences.chinese: 如果水深不見底，跳進去時腳先落水，不要俯衝下水。

sentences.english: Fathomless , it seems to be the origin of all things.
sentences.chinese: 深不見底兒，就像所有物件兒的來源。

sentences.english: The color of the sea dull gray-green and bottomless.
sentences.chinese: 海水顏色是暗灰綠色，深不見底。

sentences.english: Late at night, a night without you really deep.
sentences.chinese: 夜深了，沒有你的夜真的深不見底。

sentences.english: In the night all he couls see was a bottomless abyss.
sentences.chinese: 一晚上，他唯一能看到的就是深不見底的峽谷。

sentences.english: The structures are deep enough that, for the most part, their floors are not visible.
sentences.chinese: 這些洞穴很深，多數地方深不見底。

sentences.english: In the night all he could see was a bottomless abyss.
sentences.chinese: 一晚上，他唯一能看到的就是深不見底的深淵。

sentences.english: Everyone's heart is a piece of sea, shining bottomless blue.
sentences.chinese: 祾翴每個人的心都是一片海，閃耀着深不見底的幽藍。

definition: lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
deep and unmeasurable (idiom); unfathomable depths/incomprehensible/enigmatic and impossible to predict
lit. shocks the eye, astonishes the heart (idiom); shocking/horrible to see/a ghastly sight/also written 觸目驚心|触目惊心
to miss/to yearn day and night
all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
water so clear you can see the bottom
